snippet: The Hollywood Walk of Fame, started in 1958 and now embedded with 2,484 stars, is big business. Stars are known to say, “Can you not put me in front of a tattoo parlor.”
abstract: Hollywood Walk of Fame, one of West Coast's top tourist attractions, has become drool-worthy publicity stunt for celebrities; Ana Martinez, Hollywood Chamber of Commerce employee who decides where the stars are placed, describes her decision-making method and power she yields over anxious celebrities seeking a good spot.
lead_paragraph: The Hollywood Walk of Fame, started in 1958 and now embedded with 2,484 stars, is big business. Stars are known to say, “Can you not put me in front of a tattoo parlor.”

headline.seo: Deciding Where Stars Go on Hollywood Walk of Fame
